oai_dc:dc.dc:title: A new structure for subband adaptive filtering
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: RATHORE, TS
PAWAR, T
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A subband adaptive filter structure (SAFS) has recently been Proposed by Petraglia. Alves and Diniz (PAD). For high-order adaptive filters. it requires M/3 times (M = the number of subbands) less computations than the full band LMS algorithm. We present a modified algorithm for this SAFS in which the optimum step sizes are automatically determined instead of trial and error. The performance of the modified algorithm is compared with the PAD algorithm. A new structure (RPS) for SAF that has significantly reduced computational load (CL) is also proposed.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: 2002 STUDENT CONFERENCE ON RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT, PROCEEDINGS: GLOBALIZING RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT IN ELECTRICAL AND ELECTRONICS ENGINEERING,301-304
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Student Conference on Research and Development (SCOReD2002),SHAH ALAM, MALAYSIA,JUL 16-17, 2002
